required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study of Patients Using Levemir® or Insulatard® as Start Insulin for Treatment of Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Glycaemic Control of Levemir® or Insulatard® in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Europe. The aim of this observational study is to evaluate the glycaemic control, weight change and hypoglycaemic effects in patients with type 2 diabetes with Levemir® compared to Insulatard® under normal clinical practice conditions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months and 6 months after baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months and 6 months after baseline
at 3 months and 6 months after baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety parameters by collecting (serious) adverse events and the pregnancies.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months and 6 months after baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of general well-being by using the WHO-5 well-being questionnaire (Appendix I).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months and 6 months after baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment satisfaction of subjects treated with insulin Levemir or NPH insulin by using insulin satisfaction ('Tevredenheid met insuline behandeling': Appendix II)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months and 6 months after baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction of physicians who treat the subjects with insulin Levemir or NPH in-sulin by using a scale of 0-10 (Appendix III).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months and 6 months after baseline
at 3 months and 6 months after baseline
at 3 months and 6 months after baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in daily blood glucose values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 months and 6 months after baseline

intervention.description: Physician decides which insulin should be prescribed, selection of subjects will be at the discretion of participating physician
Physician decides which insulin should be prescribed, selection of subjects will be at the discretion of participating physician

study_pop.textblock: Insulin naïve patients with type 2 diabetes treated with oral antidiabetics

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes failing on oral blood glucose lowering therapy, and requiring insulin therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes
- Previous use of insulin
